comcmput301f16t01.github.carrier.Requests

Class RequestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • comcmput301f16t01.github.carrier.Requests.RequestController

  • public class RequestController
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses a singleton pattern to query and get results of requests. Typical use: rc.searchType( params ); // Change the singleton's information requestList = rc.getResults(); // Get the results of that search (global to program) Or use one of the getX() functions to get immediate info.

      • addDriver

        public void addDriver(Request request,
                      User driver)
        Is used to add a driver to a request.
        Parameters:
        request - The request we are modifying
        driver - the driver that is being added as a driver for the request.
        See Also:
        Offer

      • confirmDriver

        public void confirmDriver(Request request,
                          User driver)
        Is used to show that the user has accepted the provided driver. The accepted driver should have been added with addDriver() before being accepted.
        Parameters:
        request - The request that is being modified
        driver - The driver that is being accepted

      • completeRequest

        public void completeRequest(Request request)

      • payForRequest

        public void payForRequest(Request request)

      • searchByKeyword

        public void searchByKeyword(java.lang.String keyword)
        Search requests by the keyword, will set it so the singleton contains the information for this query. Use getResults() to get the information.
        Parameters:
        keyword -

      • searchByLocation

        public void searchByLocation()
        Search requests by a location. This sets it so the singleton contains the information for this query. Use getResults() to get the information.

      • getOfferedRequests

        public RequestList getOfferedRequests(User driver)
        Is used to provide a driver with a list of the requests that the driver has offered to give a ride.
        Parameters:
        driver - The driver who is requesting the list of the requests they have offered but the rider has no confirmed their choice in driver.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of requests that the driver has offered to give a ride on.

      • clearAllRiderRequests

        public void clearAllRiderRequests(User rider)

      • fetchRequestsWhereRider

        public RequestList fetchRequestsWhereRider(User rider,
                                           java.lang.Integer... statuses)
        Parameters:
        rider - the rider you want to match requests against
        statuses - the statues you would like to see (filters non listed ones) (null means grab all)
        Returns:
        A list of requests from the given criteria

        public RequestList fetchAllRequestsWhereRider(User rider)

        Get the results of a searchByKeyword or a getSearchByLocation query.

      • getDrivers

        @Deprecated
public java.util.ArrayList<User> getDrivers(Request request)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: This is literally built into a Request. (see the ArrayList of offered drivers)

      • getAvailableRequests

        @Deprecated
public java.util.ArrayList<Request> getAvailableRequests()
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: There are several other functions that do this. Also, try to only use getSearchByKeyword or getSearchByLocation

      • getInstance

public static RequestList getInstance()
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: Use getResult instead.

      • setRequestDescription

        @Deprecated
public void setRequestDescription(Request request,
                                              java.lang.String description)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: There is no user story that says we need to modify a request description after it has been created

      • getOpenRequests

public java.util.ArrayList<Request> getOpenRequests()
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: Only use getSearchByKeyword or getSearchByLocation?

      • getSearchByKeyword

public java.util.ArrayList<Request> getSearchByKeyword(java.lang.String query)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: use the void function instead (singleton changer) so that this can be used with the getResults() method
